page.title: 05Farming in St. Levan (1)
page.content: Farming in St. Levan is undergoing a {continual change}and modernization as in other parts of the country. Once {almost exclusively dairy-farming,}with some cashcrops as a sideline, it is {now diversifying into other areas. Reduction of manpower leads to more mechanization; contract machinery hire is now a feature of some cashcrops, once almost unknown except for cereal crops harvested for use as cattle food.{Landowners are amalgamating {small farms into bigger,}more economic {units as tenants vacate them.}Owners buy up adjacent smaller farms and also amalgamate. This has{lead to reducing {the number of families living in the {traditional life style of the parish. Only nine separate farm units operate within the block area; Raftra/Sawah, Bosistow/Rospletha, Roskestal/Higher Bosistow being all combined.(Cont p.6)
